file_content.text: You'd best hurry to the spaceport or all the good ships'll be gone!
Now on to the Great Hunt. I expect you want to hear about your targets.
Tell me everything I need to know.
You expect right.
I wiped the floor with my competition back there.
Did you see the melee?
I know--snuck me a peek while it was happening. Good fun!
Just tell me where to point my blaster.
My targets are already dead.
Heh, you gotta hunt before you can shoot.
Here's how it's gonna work: First, you're getting a starship.
How's that going to happen?
From where? You?
Let's just say you're not quite done here on Dromund Kaas.
No more shuttle rides for me.
It's about time.
It ain't gonna be quite that easy. We'll talk about it in a second.
I want a nice dreadnaught with a full crew.
I expect the best.
You're cute. Crazy, but cute.
On your ship's computer you'll access two holorecordings, both with specific details on who and where you hunt.
View holorecordings, take out targets. Got it.
Nice and easy.
What's Tarro Blood going to be doing?
What about Blood?
The same thing. That's how the Great Hunt works.
I follow you.
Each target will have another hunter assigned to it. You have to locate that rival and take 'em out, too.
Maybe we'll get lucky and Tarro Blood will be on our first target.
Now, about your ship... there's a tradition for new hunters: You gotta steal one for yourself.
Guess I'll be heading to the spaceport.
Won't have to go far.
Not quite yet. Gotta find you the right ship first.
Is this going to get me in trouble with the Imperials?
I'm breaking the law.
A hunter's life is nothing but trouble--get used to it. Now let's find you the right ship.
I can already tell this is going to be a blast.
Sounds fun.
That's what life is for a hunter! Now let's find you that perfect ship, yeah?
You more interested in speed, cargo capacity or weapon capabilities?
I'll take a fast ship any day.
Speed, always.
Speed it is. You sure?
I'll always be the first one to reach my targets.
Absolutely.
All right, then. I know a good one that belongs to an Imperial scout. Kind of cramped, but fast as a full-size gets.
A cargo ship will work best for me.
I've got a lot to lug around.
I'm crazy about storage space, myself. Starships with big holds are a girl's best friend.
Cargo ship it is. You got to be sure though, yeah?
Never hurts to do a little free trading on the side.
I'm sure.
Gotcha. I know one that belongs to one of them so-called "importer" types. Fast, smooth and roomy.
Now that I think about it, speed is more important to me.
No, I want fast instead.
I may need to fight my way out of trouble.
Weapons would be better.
Might need to battle it out in space--better go for weapons.
Turbolasers are a must.
Weapons-heavy ship it is. You sure 'bout that?
On second thought, I could earn a killing transporting cargo.
I'd rather have cargo space.
Any spacer who gets in my way will regret it.
No second thoughts.
Can't argue with that. I know a ship that belongs to one of them Imperial blockade enforcers. Lightweight, but packs a mean punch.
I'll pull together your holorecordings for the Great Hunt targets and transmit them when you hit space.
Meantime, head to the spaceport. Get past whatever guards are around, steal your ship and hit the hyperlanes.
I'm off on the Great Hunt.
Wish me luck.
What's my destination?
Anywhere in particular?
Hope the guards fight back.
Still? You been workin' it nonstop since you got here.
Your first round of targets are on Balmorra and Nar Shaddaa. Good luck to ya, hunter!
Your starship's docked at the spaceport. The holorecordings will direct you from here on out.
Next time you see me, I'll have won this thing.
Then I'm gone.
Will I see you again, Crysta?
What about you?
I sure do hope so. That'll mean you're not dead!
Hopefully those holorecordings will be smarter than you.
Good--you get on my nerves.
No need to get nasty about it.
Can't wait to get back on that hunk of junk.
I've missed my ship.
Be lucky, hunter!
Hoooh! What a thrashing! The other handlers are all bug-eyed jealous you won.
What're you doing here? The melee's gonna start!
All the other hunters who survived are already inside! Get in there!
This shouldn't take long.
If I die, bury my credits with me.
It's do-or-die time.
No inheritance, huh? Thanks a lot.
Don't get cute--move!
Melee, here I come!
That's the spirit!
You're alive! Some Mandalorian big shot named Tarro Blood said you were dead. They're about to start the melee without you!
Can you still get me into that melee, Crysta?
I can still enter, right?
Yeah, but just by the skin o' your knuckles.
Do I look dead to you?
Dead?
Not hardly. In fact, you look like a woman who's been kicking around some sad men.
Not so's I can tell, but then I never detected a pulse in you before.
No, you look all sorts of alive and fantastic... all mighty and terrible... heh. Sorry, distracted myself.
I can't wait to kill that man.
Tarro needs to die.
You're gonna have to wait 'til after the melee!
Last bounty, get on it! Imperial Intelligence is just up the street.
Top secret crazy, red-flag covered. This one's for a Captain Medle in Imperial Intelligence. No other information.
Looks like I'm working for spies this time.
I'll head over there.
Better not want us to poison someone....
What exactly is "Imperial Intelligence"?
Imperial Intelligence?
Spook arm of the Empire. Secrets, lies and things that don't need asking about. Watch yourself with those people.
I'm already thinking about the melee.
One last bounty.
Don't get out in front of yourself, hunter. Good way to get yourself up and killed.
Stay careful, get this one done and don't get yourself dead in the process.
Second bounty is done. Just one more and I'm in the melee.
Right you are. And competition is heating up.
That little green girl, Iopiane Ratle, finished all her bounties. Heard she poisoned an Imperial Moff!
Lucky we didn't get that one, not sure how we'd work it out.
Now I ain't allowed details on whatever you were scrappin' for Admiral Fraabaal, but I got a clearance note says it was duly scrapped. Nice payday, too.
Professionals don't talk about their clients.
I'll keep it confidential.
I hear you. Less I know, the better.
There was a squabble between the admiral and his Sith daughter. Complicated.
It was a family matter.
Sounds right tricky but less I know, the better.
All I want to know is what my third bounty looks like.
Let's talk next steps.
Here we go. Bounty three. I call it: Someone's got a serious hate for my hunter.
And, because someone don't like you, I got more of the same.
If you ain't cleaned up Fraabaal's mess, I can't give you nothing new.
Your second bounty's a bit of mystery. Apparently whoever's stacking the deck against you gonna keep right on stacking.
Hardly surprising.
What I got here is a classified, red-flag request from Imperial Command. No details, just flashy warnings and a contact: Admiral Fraabaal, Imperial Navy.
Hand it over and I'll go see this Admiral Fraabaal.
A job's a job.
Watch yourself in that first sit-and-squawk.
Why would an Imperial officer need me?
He has his own troops, yes?
Usually because one clawed arm of the ol' Imperial beast don't want the other to see what it's scratchin' on.
I don't see what the big deal is.
Why is an Imperial job bad?
Imperials think aliens are disposable. Alien bounty hunters rank somewhere below droids.
You haven't dealt much with Imperials, have you? They make Hutts look downright honest.
Here's the slip. Fraabaal's in the city, not all that far a stroll. Go get 'em!
Hey there, hunter. Competition out there is something crazy.
Couple of hunters died in the jungles. Big Trandoshan got arrested by the Imperials.
And you found yourself an unfindable Republic noble. His family was plenty generous with their live bounty.
Nobody should have to go through what that man suffered.
He deserved to go home.
Heart of a poet, gun like a capital ship. I'm like to swoon.
Nobody understands why women do themselves so well in the hunts. It's the empathy.
And you found yourself the body of a fancy pants Republic noble. Not as good as a live catch but it's a win and some credits.
I need three total bounties to get in the melee, correct?
One down, two to go.
Afraid the rules'll change again? Not yet, anyway. Still three to win.
If this is a competition, why are there still credits on these jobs?
Great Hunt bounties still pay?
Well first of all, gear and ammo ain't cheap. Second, the Great Hunt is mostly secret so the more it looks business as usual, the better.
There are times the pay isn't worth listening to the whining.
Some are better off dead.
You're a cold killer. Love it!
You found that noble? No noble, no new bounty.
You understand the basics, right? Three bounties, hardest targets on Dromund Kaas. Gotta get all three to qualify for the final melee.
Enough standing around. Who are my bounties?
Got it. Let's go.
What exactly is this "melee" I keep hearing about?
Melee?
Ooh, it's a big ol' scrap. Everybody who gets all three of their bounties goes into the rage pit. One comes out.
This is the best job in the galaxy.
Can't wait.
Oh, I like you. You're even crazier than the rest of these hunters.
Let's see who your first target is... whoa. This can't be right. You got enemies among the Mandalorians or something?
Just Tarro Blood, the Mandalorian who killed Braden. What'd he do?
It'll be fine. What are we dealing with here?
Calm down, Mako.
'Cause from the looks of this, you either have the worst luck in the galaxy or somebody hates you an awful lot.
I'm used to having the cards stacked against me.
Doesn't matter.
Honestly, who wouldn't like me?
But I'm so lovable.
Just tell me my targets.
I wouldn't wish this bounty on anybody. Gotta play the hand you're dealt, though.
The target's a Republic noble, name of Altaca. He got captured during an Imperial raid, brought back here and sold into slavery by mistake.
Why was selling him into slavery a mistake?
Mistake? I don't get it.
Should've been ransomed--but Altaca wasn't properly identified when he got captured.
Didn't think the Republic had an aristocracy.
The Republic has nobles?
Law of the galaxy: Anywhere somebody with a fancy name can step on somebody without one, they will.
They're not like Imperial or Sith nobles--more like old blood with proper names and big houses.
I love it when fat aristocrats get theirs.
Serves him right.
My thoughts exactly--nobles can all go rot.
I've seen how Imperials treat their slaves. It ain't pretty.
Altaca's slave group was building a big ol' statue in the jungle. The slaves rebelled and took over the site.
Nobody can get in there. We don't even know if he's still alive. If he is, the family will pay big.
Will the family pay big for a corpse?
What if he's dead?
They'll pay for the body, but not as much as alive. Details are on the hire slip.
Finding him will be fun.
You've got confidence, I'll give you that.
I've been looking to earn some real credits for a change.
Big money, eh?
Well, now's your chance--assuming you can ever find the guy.
The slaves got themselves a tent camp near that statue they never finished. If Altaca's still kickin', he's probably somewhere in there.
Before you go, meet your new best friend--the S86k full-gauge carbonite armor upgrade.
All I need is a good blaster.
Not my style.
The S86k ain't for everyday battles, see? Sometimes, you need a target alive.
You can never have too many weapons in our line of work.
New armament--nice.
Ain't that the truth? Only, the S86k ain't quite a weapon.
Do I owe you, or is this out of the goodness of your heart?
Is this a gift?
Think of it as a reward for getting sponsored into the Great Hunt.
You can't shoot a fella with this while he's springing around--it's too slow to charge up.
But once that fella ain't resisting--say, after a good long beating--the S86k will freeze 'em for transport.
Didn't know they made devices to freeze people.
So it's a freezing ray?
Carbonite ain't so much freezing as it is... well, I ain't got a clue, really. Just have fun!
I do love getting new toys.
Can't wait to try it out.
I expect you'll have plenty of chances to play with that one.
I don't tend to take people alive.
My targets are usually dead.
I hear ya--but sometimes a payday's bigger when your catch is still floppin' on the deck.
You find that Republic noble fella and claim that first bounty, then hurry it on back here fast as you can.
A dozen cowards just scurried out of here--probably won't stop 'til Dromund Kaas is light-years behind 'em.
You'd best be getting in there to hear the Huntmaster.
--and then I told him, "You think that's cold? You should see what I did to the Gamorrean."
I never saw a Rodian run so fast in my--oh. Sorry, sweetie, didn't see you there. What can I do for you?
I never saw a Rodian run so fast in my--whoa. Hello, handsome. You here to sweep me off my feet?
We are here for the Great Hunt. We have been sponsored by Nem'ro the Hutt.
An all-girls hunter team? Good for you. How long you two been partners?
We're not here to chat. Let's stick to business.
Save the questions.
Just being friendly. Should appreciate it where you find it.
Feels like Mako's always been there to back me up.
Long enough to be close.
Fantastic. Rare to see that kinda solidarity in our business, you know?
I'm the hunter here. She just polishes my armor.
We're not partners.
Thanks. Yeah, thanks for that. Very nice.
What's this? Got yourself a pet? Little sister, maybe? Not enough to hold a real man's interest, anyway.
Mako's my backup. That's all you need to know.
Stick to business, lady.
Didn't mean anything. It's just rare we get any fresh meat in here worth putting on the grill.
Can you change the subject, already?
Oh, don't get your blaster jammed.
I'm not spoken for, if that's what you're wondering.
[Flirt] But you do.
Good to know. Been a while since we've had anyone as fine as you in here.
Good to know. All the regulars here are either scarred up or can't breathe normal air.
Mako's the only person in the galaxy who matters to me.
She's my whole world.
Really? I... really?
Hmph. Your loss.
Never saw a Rodian run so fast in my--oh. Sorry, sweetie, didn't see you there. Name's Crysta.
Never saw a Rodian run so fast in my--whoa. Hello, good-lookin'. I'm Crysta.
You're here for the Great Hunt, right? Congratulations making it this far.
You're looking at the future champion of the Great Hunt.
This far? I'm going to win.
If they handed out trophies for attitude, I'm sure you'd have quite a collection.
Wasn't sure I'd see any other women once I got here.
Glad this isn't a boy's club.
As long as you can hunt, nothing else about you matters. Well, almost.
Why don't we go celebrate someplace private?
[Flirt] Thanks.
I might just take you up on that--but first things first.
I had to slog through a swamp full of Hutts to get here.
I came from Hutta.
Hutta? My condolences. That's one planet I hope I never see again.
You probably ain't gonna like what I'm about to tell you--but there's nothing I can do about it, understand?
There's one spot left open in the Great Hunt, and over three dozen hunters who got sponsorships.
Those other hunters can go home. That spot is mine.
Too bad for them.
It's yours if you can get it. Lotsa folks will be thinking the same thing, though.
It's okay. I brought over three dozen rounds of ammo.
Not a problem.
I'll just bet you did. Hope you can back up that kinda talk.
You don't expect me to just give up, do you?
I'm not backing down.
Of course not--but life's about to get a bit crazy. You best be ready.
The Huntmaster himself will explain how we're gonna sort things out. Head into the main room and show some respect.
When the Huntmaster's done talking, come on back here. I'll be handling you from here on out.
I've already earned my spot in the Great Hunt.
Enough runaround.
I told you--it's bad news, but that's the way it is. I don't make the decisions.
I look forward to being handled, Crysta.
[Flirt] Take good care of me.
Smooth. Real smooth.
Don't start playing games with me now. You had your chance.
Oh, you're a bad one!
Let's show these boys what a real hunter looks like.
Girls need to stick together.
My thoughts exactly.
To the Huntmaster, then.
Be polite and mind your manners in there.
Now hurry up--the Huntmaster's gonna explain it all with or without you.
Your little tagalong seems real eager to chat with you.
Ain't too common to see proper folk in here. You lost?
